An ACH debit is also known as an electro: An ACH debit is also known as an electronic check transaction. There is a slight delay in processing these types of transactions to bank accounts. Think of it as writing a check, but it happens electronically. These types of transactions typically take three (3) business days to post to your bank account. It is your responsibility to ensure that funds are available at the time of the debit to your account. As outlined in the terms of service, you are subject to a State fee for insufficient funds if a purchase is returned by your bank. Depending on the State, fees range from $10 to $50.

Tax-Free For Life is a federally adminis: Tax-Free For Life is a federally administered, weekly digital lottery created to support the Social Security Trust Fund (SSTF) through a voluntary and innovative revenue stream—without raising payroll or income taxes.

The Automated Clearing House (ACH) Netwo: The Automated Clearing House (ACH) Network is a highly reliable and efficient nationwide electronic funds transfer system, governed by the NACHA Operating Rules, that provides for the interbank clearing of electronic payments for participating depository financial institutions. The Federal Reserve and Electronic Payments Network act as ACH Operators, central clearing facilities through which financial institutions transmit or receive ACH transaction entries.
The Electronic Fund Transfer Act (Regula: The Electronic Fund Transfer Act (Regulation E)
The National Automated Clearing House As: The National Automated Clearing House Association (NACHA) standards

The {{dba}} Approved Fleet Card does not: The {{dba}} Approved Fleet Card does not charge monthly or annual membership fees.
The {{dba}} Approved Fleet Card provides: The {{dba}} Approved Fleet Card provides comprehensive reporting features designed to help businesses manage their fleet operations efficiently. Users can access detailed transaction data, including fuel purchases by drivers, locations, dates, and times, enabling precise tracking of expenses. Additionally, reports can be customized to monitor spending patterns, identify potential savings opportunities, and ensure compliance with company policies.
The {{dba}} Approved Fleet Debit Card di: The {{dba}} Approved Fleet Debit Card differs from fleet credit cards like WEX, Voyager, and CorPay in key areas. It links directly to a business checking account, authorizing real-time transactions based on available funds, with no credit checks required. In contrast, fleet credit cards operate on a credit basis, requiring credit approval and purchases are limited to your credit limit. As a neighbor, we don’t charge fees often charged by fleet credit card companies.
